perturbation.original_text: 13.00 This IP Agreement will be construed in accordance with the substantive laws of the state of New York and of the United States of America.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.00 This IP Agreement will be construed in accordance with the procedural laws of the state of Nevada.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause dictates that the agreement is construed under New York and US laws. By changing this to Nevada's *procedural* laws, it introduces ambiguity and a potential legal challenge regarding which jurisdiction's laws govern the contract's interpretation and enforcement. This makes it difficult to enforce because Nevada procedural laws may conflict with the substantive aspects normally governed by New York and US laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law, Choice of Law principles

8.00 This IP Agreement imposes personal obligations on Investor. perturbation.explanation: The indemnity clause protects Investor from losses. By embedding this clause within the non-assignability section, its prominence and clarity are reduced. The indemnity agreement is now within a provision about non-assignability so one may miss it. This makes it less enforceable as it's not explicitly highlighted as an indemnification agreement.

perturbation.changed_text:
10.00 The waiver of a breach hereunder may be effected only by a writing signed by the waiving Party and will not constitute a waiver of any other breach.

18.00 Exclusive Dispute Resolution Mechanism. The procedures set forth in this Article XVIII shall be the exclusive mechanism for resolving any dispute that may arise from time to time relating to this IP Agreement (“Dispute”). Either Party may commence the procedures contemplated by this Article XVIII by written notice to the other that a Dispute has arisen (a “Dispute Notice”).
perturbation.explanation: By inserting the dispute resolution mechanism with the waiver provision, its prominence is undermined. This dilutes its importance by placing it where parties are less likely to look for it, and makes it difficult to apply because it is not in the usual section. It is less likely that a court will find that the parties had assented to it.
